Vulnerabilities.Title: lodash: Prototype pollution in utilities function
Vulnerabilities.Description: A prototype pollution vulnerability was found in lodash <4.17.11 where the functions merge, mergeWith, and defaultsDeep can be tricked into adding or modifying properties of Object.prototype.

Vulnerabilities.Title: curl: Use-after-free when closing "easy" handle in Curl_close()
Vulnerabilities.Description: A heap use-after-free flaw was found in curl versions from 7.59.0 through 7.61.1 in the code related to closing an easy handle.

Vulnerabilities.Title: curl: NTLMv2 type-3 header stack buffer overflow
Vulnerabilities.Description: libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow.

Vulnerabilities.Title: curl: Integer overflow leading to heap-based buffer overflow in Curl_sasl_create_plain_message()
Vulnerabilities.Description: Curl versions 7.33.0 through 7.61.1 are vulnerable to a buffer overrun in the SASL authentication code that may lead to denial of service.

Vulnerabilities.Title: git: Improper handling of PATH allows for commands to be executed from the current directory
Vulnerabilities.Description: Git before 2.19.2 on Linux and UNIX executes commands from the current working directory (as if '.' were at the end of $PATH) in certain cases involving the run_command() API and run-command.c, because there was a dangerous change from execvp to execv during 2017.

Vulnerabilities.Title: git: arbitrary code execution via .gitmodules
Vulnerabilities.Description: Git before 2.14.5, 2.15.x before 2.15.3, 2.16.x before 2.16.5, 2.17.x before 2.17.2, 2.18.x before 2.18.1, and 2.19.x before 2.19.1 allows remote code execution during processing of a recursive "git clone" of a superproject if a .gitmodules file has a URL field beginning with a '-' character.
